Spatial Algebra

This module implements the spatial algebra as described in Featherstone book. More...

Collaboration diagram for Spatial Algebra:

Modules

 Transforms

Detailed Description

This module implements the spatial algebra as described in Featherstone book.

Definitions

The motion space is used to represent velocity, acceleration, infinitesimal displacement, and finally directions of motion freedom and constraint.

The elements of describe the forces acting on a solid body, and the related quantities: momentum, impulse, and directions of force freedom and constraint.

A very important object is the Transform which allows to transfer a spatial vector in the motion space or in the force space from frame to another frame .

The Transform uses Plucker coordinates to represent motion with a point and a rotation matrix .

Quick start

   #include <metapod/tools/spatial.hh>
